summary: This bill, the Extreme Risk Protection Order Expansion Act of 2025, aims to support state, tribal, and local efforts to remove firearms from individuals deemed a danger to themselves or others. It establishes a grant program for eligible entities to implement and administer extreme risk protection orders (ERPOs), providing funding for training, data collection, and public awareness campaigns.  The bill also amends federal law to include individuals subject to ERPOs in firearm prohibitions and mandates full faith and credit for ERPOs across state and tribal jurisdictions. It includes provisions for data collection and reporting.
